title: Malaysia: Giant and Citibank Increase Rebates to Address Rising Prices
summary: Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia – Giant and Citibank are introducing the new Giant-Citibank Credit Card to help customers enjoy comprehensive benefits and will set new industry benchmarks in the form of highest rebates for daily grocery purchases in the market today.
tag-1: Malaysia: Giant and Citibank Increase Rebates to Address Rising Prices
tag-3: Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia – Giant and Citibank are introducing the new Giant-Citibank Credit Card to help customers enjoy comprehensive benefits and will set new industry benchmarks in the form of highest rebates for daily grocery purchases in the market today.
tag-4: By consolidating their monthly spend on the new Giant-Citibank Credit Card, customers will now earn up to a 5 percent rebate on all purchases made at Giant stores nationwide and up to a 2 percent rebate on selected utilities and dining spending.
tag-5: Additional benefits include exclusive Giant-Citibank Credit Card member prices, the opportunity to earn more rebates during special occasions, festive seasons and new store openings; and discounts and privileges at more than 40,000 local and global merchant partners' outlets.
tag-6: A Shopper Trends Report by Nielsen indicated that, as expected, grocery shoppers have become very discerning; they are aware of price changes and actively search for promotions while shopping. Their other key priorities included convenience (proximity to home) and stores that have a good selection of quality products. The report also showed a spending increase on grocery, food and personal-care items across the high- and low-income groups.
tag-7: Anand Cavale, Business Head for Cards and Consumers Lending of Citibank Berhad, said: "Consumers today are very discerning about their consumption patterns. With financial security continuing to be an important focus among shoppers, we believe our Giant-Citibank Credit Card will help savvy shoppers generate significant savings for their daily purchases, more so for those whose main budget items focus on groceries. For instance, the average family usually spends approximately RM1200 a month on groceries, utilities bills, dining and other essential purchases. By using this card, they save up to RM324 in savings a year!"
tag-8: "The more shoppers consolidate their monthly spending on this card, the more they will save on groceries purchases at all Giant stores. It has all the benefits that a Citibank Gold card offers, with additional savings and discounts and the lowest annual fees in the market for such a product," he added.
tag-9: Mr. Tom Herriott, Chief Operating Officer of GCH Retail (Malaysia) Sdn Bhd, the owner of Giant outlets, said: "This Giant-Citibank Credit Card reflects our unwavering commitment to respond to consumers' needs by delivering big variety, great value and everyday low prices to Malaysians; despite the intense competition and the pressures from rising costs.
tag-10: "As the leader in the hypermarket retailing sector, we believe we have to set the pace in serving our customers by continuously offering innovative products and services."
tag-11: "There are 110 Giant outlets nationwide, and they register some 11 million sales transactions a month in total. We expect a significant portion of our customers to take up this card with the enhanced benefits and greater savings," he added.
tag-12: Citibank expects to attract 100,000 new cardholders in the next three years following the launch.
tag-13: "At Citibank, we have been cognizant of consumer spending trends. Our commitment to responsible finance and to banking means introducing innovative products and services that serve the consumers. Credit cards such as the Giant-Citibank Credit Card, when used responsibly, earn more savings and enjoy a more rewarding lifestyle for themselves and their families," said Fabio Fontainha, Consumer Markets Head for Citibank Berhad.
tag-14: Selected merchants of the Giant-Citibank Credit Card include Celcom, DiGi, Maxis, Astro, TNB, Telekom, SESCO, Sabah Electricity and restaurants such as Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf, Baskin Robbins, Chicken Rice Shop, Dominos Pizza, Esquire Kitchen, Kenny Rogers, KFC, Nando's, Pizza Hut, Sakae Sushi, Secret Recipe, Sushi King. Customers can earn rebates when they use the Giant-Citibank Credit Card at these outlets.
tag-15: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

tag-17: Giant  Giant is the leading retailing chain in Malaysia with stores conveniently located throughout the country. Giant's Hypermarkets offer over 100,000 items ranging from fresh produce, household items, daily essentials and general merchandise; including over 3,000 house brand products. With a track record of 67 years, Giant is today synonymous with "Everyday Low Prices, Big Variety and Great Value". It has been voted as the hypermarket of choice by Malaysian consumers in the Shoppers' Trend Survey. Giant is owned by GCH Retail (Malaysia) Sdn Bhd, which also operates Guardian and Cold Storage Supermarkets. For more information, please visit www.giant.com.my.
